title: Baby Massage: An Ayurvedic Guide for New Parents
author: Harish
excerpt: Daily infant abhyanga is one of Ayurveda’s most cherished rituals. Learn how it supports growth, digestion, and sleep.
content:
Why Baby Massage Matters

Abhyanga is more than bonding — it supports nervous system development, digestion, circulation, and emotional security. Ayurveda recommends gentle daily massage as a stabilizing ritual for infants.

Choosing the Right Oil

  • Coconut oil: Cooling and ideal for warm climates.
  • Sesame oil: Warming and grounding for cooler months.
  • Brahmi & calendula: Mild herbs that soothe and protect delicate skin.

How to Perform Infant Abhyanga

  1. Warm the oil lightly.
  2. Use soft strokes along arms and legs.
  3. Massage tummy clockwise to support digestion.
  4. Keep the room warm and comfortable.

Safety Essentials

Patch-test every new oil. Avoid scented oils or strong herbs. Always consult your pediatrician before introducing any herbal products for newborns.
